models.name: AuditStamp
models.doc: Data captured on a resource/association/sub-resource level giving insight into when that resource/association/sub-resource moved into a particular lifecycle stage, and who acted to move it into that specific lifecycle stage.

fields.name: time

type.name: Time
type.doc: Number of milliseconds since midnight, January 1, 1970 UTC. It must be a positive number

fields.doc: When did the resource/association/sub-resource move into the specific lifecycle stage represented by this AuditEvent.

fields.name: actor
fields.doc: The entity (e.g. a member URN) which will be credited for moving the resource/association/sub-resource into the specific lifecycle stage. It is also the one used to authorize the change.

fields.name: impersonator
fields.doc: The entity (e.g. a service URN) which performs the change on behalf of the Actor and must be authorized to act as the Actor.

models.name: Aspect
models.doc:
Placeholder PDL record to store the aspect in the response. By using this place-holder, metadata-service can return
any type of aspect without having to define a single union class

models.name: AspectType
models.doc: The type of a DataHub aspect

symbolDocs.TIMESERIES: Designates an aspect that represents a point-in-time data point
symbolDocs.VERSIONED: Designates an aspect that has a monotonically increasing version number

models.name: EntityResponse
models.doc: A DataHub 'entity', which is comprised of a set of latest aspects present for the aspect.

fields.name: aspects

values.name: EnvelopedAspect
values.doc:
An aspect, along with the metadata about it.
Currently, an aspect can be either of type 'timestamp' or 'versioned'.

fields.name: type
fields.doc: The type of the aspect, either timeseries or versioned

fields.name: version
fields.doc: The version of the aspect, only populated if type is 'VERSIONED'

fields.name: timestamp
fields.doc: The timestamp of the aspect, only populated if type is 'TIMESTAMP'

fields.name: value
fields.doc: The raw value of the aspect

fields.name: created
fields.doc: The audit stamp detailing who the aspect was created by and when
A map of aspect name to aspect

schema.name: entitiesV2
schema.doc:
Single unified resource for fetching, updating, searching, & browsing DataHub entities

generated from: com.linkedin.metadata.resources.entity.EntityV2Resource

methods.doc: Retrieves the value for an entity that is made up of latest versions of specified aspects.
